thread.title: Cody Shear, Sheldon 3-star OL, flips from Arizona Wildcats to Oregon Ducks
thread.title_full: Cody Shear, Sheldon 3-star OL, flips from Arizona Wildcats to Oregon Ducks

author: Andrew Nemec | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Cody Shear, Sheldon 3-star OL, flips from Arizona Wildcats to Oregon Ducks
text:
Cody Shear, Sheldon 3-star OL, flips from Arizona Wildcats to Oregon Ducks Cody Shear 
Sheldon offensive lineman Cody Shear spent his entire childhood dreaming of one day running out of the tunnel at Autzen Stadium. 
It took until Signing Day to get his offer, but he'll finally have that chance. 
The 6-foot-3, 275-pound interior lineman, out of Eugene, Oregon, announced his commitment to Oregon on Wednesday morning, becoming the fourth Arizona Wildcats pledge to switch to the Ducks: I've been going to games at Autzen stadium since I was a little kid. I've decided to sign to my home town team, The Oregon Ducks. Go Ducks! pic.twitter.com/AbYftuYNp6 -- Cody Shear (@Codyshear7) February 1, 2017 
"It's hard to look past your dream," Shear said. "I've been an Oregon Duck fan since the day I showed up on the Earth. There were definitely times that I was thinking Arizona didn't deserve this. Those coaches were the first Power 5 conference team to offer me, and their coaches are class acts." 
For Shear, the commitment to Oregon marks the end of a stressful flirtation with the Ducks that lasted two coaching staffs and several months. 
That flirtation finally turned to a commitment on Oregon's behalf Wednesday morning. 
"I got a text from coach (Mario) Cristobal really early this morning," Shear explained. "I talked to him the first time at 5:30. Basically, he said, 'I'm in a meeting right now. I need to know what time you are signing.' I told him I was supposed to sign with Arizona at 7 o' clock. I got a text that told me to call coach Willie Taggart before I signed, and he told me, 'You've grown up down the street from Autzen. Who do you want to play for?' I told him Oregon and they offered me a full ride." 
Not surprisingly, Shear's announcement was met with a quick phone call from a close friend and familiar face for Duck fans. 
The first guy that called me was Alex Forsyth," Shear said. "We're friends, so he was just really excited for me." 
Shear is the third offensive lineman in the class for Oregon, joining Forsyth and George Moore, the nation's No. 1 junior college offensive lineman. 
He also marks the fourth Arizona commit to flip to the Ducks since Taggart's hiring, joining quarterback Braxton Burmeister, defensive lineman Austin Faoliu and athlete Darrian McNeal.
